As someone who has no nostalgia and playing this in 2021, I can confidently say that this is one of the greatest first person shooters of all time. Definitely worth your money.

Played this game for the first time during the lead up to Half Life: Alyx. I really enjoyed it. The atmosphere and audio are very immersive, and I really enjoyed the fast paced action and brain scratching puzzles. Some sections better than others, but when this game is firing on all cylinders, it's a really good time.

Gordon Freeman in the flesh. Or rather, in the hazard suit. I took the liberty of relieving you of your weapons; most of them were government property. As for the suit, I think you‚Äôve earned it. The borderworld, Xen, is in our control for the time being, thanks to you. Quite a nasty piece of work you managed over there. I am impressed. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here, Mr. Freeman. I have recommended your services to my employers, and they have authorized me to offer you a job. They agree with me that you have limitless potential. You‚Äôve proved yourself a decisive man, so I don‚Äôt expect you‚Äôll have any trouble deciding what to do. If you‚Äôre interested, just step into the portal and I will take that as a yes. Otherwise...well...I can offer you a battle you have no chance of winning. Rather an anticlimax, after what you‚Äôve just survived. Time to choose.

I can't believe I've just played this for the first time.. a true masterpiece.

I would say I am largely a Half-Life novice as I never played any of the games close to when they came out and I have spent the better part of COVID trying out some of these games to a lot of surprise and joy while questioning how it took me so long to play it.

Half-Life felt like a culmination of a lot of my favorite Valve games with puzzles like Portal, combat like Counter Strike, and just a lot of fun, quirky, weird dialogue, story, and easter eggs that added to my overall experience with the game. I totally understand why Half-Life is so revered and I am glad I was able to experience it without knowing much about it beforehand. If you are on the fence, you definitely won't regret playing this game and it is actually really cool to see the groundwork for where so many Valve properties started.
Play it. it's awesome and while you at it, play Black Mesa too
It's half life. Timeless and always fun to play!

It's really a classic game, but it's dated nowadays.
If you wanna try it, have patience, persistence and remember, google is your "friend".

Aside from one bug that forced me to skip a section, the game ran flawlessly and made for an excellent experience. I recommend playing on the 'hard' difficulty so you truly feel like a four-eyed scientist facing off against the world's greatest military superpower with only a crowbar.

Je me suis surpris √† aimer ce jeu quand j'y ai jou√© pour la premi√®re fois il y a une semaine, malgr√© son √¢ge.
C'est vrai qu'il est (tr√®s) tr√®s vieux : les captures d'√©cran sur la page du magasin ne le rajeunissent pas du tout. Pourtant, il y a quelque chose de particulier dans ce jeu qui fait accrocher quiconque tente l'aventure.

Le gameplay est tr√®s bon, pas √©tonnant quand on sait que c'est le jeu qui a pos√© les bases des FPS d'action avec histoire. L'histoire tiens, parlons-en : comme son petit-fils Half Life 2, Half Life narre extr√™mement bien son histoire. Pas de texte qui s'affiche √† l'√©cran, pas de codex ou je ne sais quoi, juste une aventure immersive, sans interruption (enfin, une seule en rapport avec l'histoire), o√π l'on garde toujours le contr√¥le de Gordon Freeman !

Le level design est tr√®s bien fait aussi, tout comme le monde en lui-m√™me. C'est un jeu d'horreur sans en √™tre un : les cr√©atures sont bizarres et les boss sont intimidants, sans parler de l'ambiance glauque, mais cela ne suffit pas √† effrayer un joueur arm√© de tout un arsenal divers et vari√© : tr√®s bon √©quilibre ambiance/action.

Bref, vous vous demandez si vous devez jouer √† ce jeu ou non ? N'h√©sitez pas plus et prenez le Valve Complete Pack le jour des soldes, pour √† peine 5-6‚Ç¨ vous avez 22 jeux de fou !

10/10
Good game, very difficult because of the old school mechanics but you'll get use to it.

I like the game.  Gameplay is nice and smooth, but movement is slidey.  So when I'm suddenly under fire, I'll run to hide behind a crate or something, but then I'll slide past it and have to adjust and usually get hit.  sort of annoying.  Another thing: I really, really wish there were more healing items where you could just heal on the spot.  That would be nice.  Other then those 2 things, really like the game.  At the beginning when all the zombie aliens started popping up, I was really jumpy lol.  Like, I'll just be walking around and then I'll hear the creepy skittery noises that the Head Crabs make and I'll be really on edge.  I'll turn a corner and they jump out and you and I'd shoot 5 rounds of my shotgun and miss every shot because I jumped xD.  The game started to settle down with the jump scares when the military showed up tho.  Also, thank the lord that this game has built in save slots because some of the areas can get hard (playing on medium).  Graphics are good?  I think?  Were these good graphics for 1998?  They look good on my new PC tho.  The ending is... kinda weird.  Cuz it's like, "go into the portal Freemen and fight some aliens!"  And I'm like, "why do I have to go into the portal?"  "No time just go!"  "ok then".  They don't really explain stuff, y'know?  Also looking forward to seeing more of the guy at the very end, he was interesting.  Overall, good game 8/10.  Looking forward to so called god tier game that's Half-Life 2.

Although i am glad i played this game, it was ass. I have zero clue how this can be considered one of the greatest games of all time. it was good but very below average. 1. The physics were horrible, one slight press of D and you will go flying to the right to a point of uncontrollability. The map design was sheer and utter Tom-Foolery. This game requires the most outlandish and unthinkable shit. either you drop into a room with nothing but a glock and have to fight 60 vortagons or you have to do something with no queue to figure out. Now to be fair there were some great moments, the first 4 hours are incredible and really makes you feel scared and defenceless in this new alien world but the quality goes down very quickly. Sheer and utter assular garbage

A classic shooter I enjoyed so much. A masterpiece for his time like doom. The AI is surprisingly impressive but the physics quite slippery (either way I didn't mind as I get used to it). It's worth trying.
